content.question: If <math alttext="f of x equals, 5 times x to the sixth power, minus 3 times x to the fifth power, plus 2 times x cubed, minus x squared, plus e cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="f prime of x, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="5 times x to the fifth power, minus 3 times x to the fourth power, plus 2 times x squared, minus x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="30 times x to the fifth power, minus 15 times x to the fourth power, plus 6 times x squared, minus 2 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="30 times x to the fifth power, minus 15 times x to the fourth power, plus 6 times x squared, minus 2 x, plus 3 times e squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="30 times x to the sixth power, minus 15 times x to the fifth power, plus 6 times x cubed, minus 2 times x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="30 times x to the fifth power, minus 15 times x to the fourth power, plus 6 times x squared, minus 2 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.6: Derivative Rules - Constant, Sum, Difference, and Constant Multiple

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
